item.title: 越南前 FLC 主席股票欺诈案审判将于本月开始
item.description: 根据政府网站上的公告，对房地产开发商 FLC Group JSC 前董事长 Trinh Van Quyet 及其他 49 名被告的股票操纵案的审判将于 7 月 22 日开始。【原文：The stock manipulation trial of real estate developer FLC Group JSC’s former chairman Trinh Van Quyet and 49 other defendants will begin July 22, according to a posting on the government’s website.】

item.title: 波兰重启为欧盟最昂贵抵押贷款提供补贴的计划
item.description: 波兰政府正在重启帮助借款人偿还欧盟最昂贵抵押贷款的计划。【原文：Poland’s government is reviving plans to help borrowers struggling to pay back the European Union’s costliest mortgages.】

item.title: 对冲基金在电池金属低迷之际囤积钴矿
item.description: 包括 Anchorage Capital Advisors 和 Squarepoint Capital LLP 在内的对冲基金一直在通过买入实物材料建立钴仓位，因为现货价格下跌和流动性更强的期货市场为这种电池金属创造了新的交易机会。【原文：Hedge funds including Anchorage Capital Advisors and Squarepoint Capital LLP have been building positions in cobalt by buying up physical material, as tumbling spot prices and a more liquid futures market create new trading opportunities in the battery metal.】

item.title: 波音公司因欺诈指控和 Spirit 公司的交易而首当其冲
item.description: 在机身爆炸事故使波音公司陷入危机六个月后，这起近乎灾难性的事故所带来的法律和财务后果正向这家陷入困境的美国飞机制造商全面压来。【原文：Six months after a fuselage blowout threw Boeing Co. into crisis, the full weight of the legal and financial fallout from the near-catastrophic accident is bearing down on the embattled US planemaker.】

item.title: 基思-吉尔披露持有 2.45 亿美元股份后，Chewy 股价大涨
item.description: 周一盘前交易中，Chewy Inc. 股价最高上涨 29%，此前 Keith Gill 披露被动持有这家在线宠物食品和产品零售商 6.6% 的股份。【原文：Chewy Inc. shares rose as much as 29% in premarket trading Monday after Keith Gill disclosed a 6.6% passive stake in the online pet food and product retailer.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事美洲
item.description: 早上好。法国的中间派和左翼政党正在竞相阻止该国极右翼在第一轮立法选举后的势头。波音公司（Boeing）将结束数十年的分离状态，收购 Spirit Aero，而贝莱德集团（BlackRock）正在扩大其私人资产能力。24 小时股票交易的蓬勃发展令华尔街哗然。以下是交易员们正在谈论的话题— Morwenna Coniam【原文：Good morning. France’s centrist and left-wing parties are racing to stop the momentum of the country’s far right following the first round in a legislative election. Boeing is ending decades of separation as it moves to buy Spirit Aero, while BlackRock is expanding its private asset capabilities. And a boom in 24-hour stock trading is rattling Wall Street. Here’s what traders are talking about — Morwenna Coniam】

item.title: 据说马士基考虑退出德铁信可竞标
item.description: 美联社 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Moeller-Maersk A/S公司正在考虑放弃对德国铁路股份公司（Deutsche Bahn AG）旗下物流部门德铁信可公司（DB Schenker）的收购。【原文：AP Moeller-Maersk A/S is considering dropping it pursuit of DB Schenker, the logistics unit of Deutsche Bahn AG, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 震撼拉美的对冲基金鲸鱼在墨西哥曝光
item.description: 6 月 7 日清晨，墨西哥利率期货大幅飙升。整整一周以来，即使比索在执政的左派政党取得压倒性胜利后暴跌，利率期货仍保持稳定。但现在，抛售突然蔓延到了利率市场。【原文：Early in the morning of June 7, interest-rate futures spiked wildly in Mexico. All week long, they had held steady even as the peso plunged in the wake of the ruling leftist party’s landslide election victory. But now, the selloff was suddenly spilling into the rates market.】

item.title: 高盛的科斯汀称美国的盈利门槛将达到 2021 年以来的最高点
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Corporate America faces the highest earnings bar in almost three years as it prepares to report second-quarter results, according to Goldman Sachs Group Inc. strategists.】

item.title: Revolut 准备 2023 年业绩，推动英国银行执照申请
item.description: Revolut Ltd.在其审计师签署了 2023 年的账目后，正在准备其 2023 年的财务业绩，这使得这家金融科技公司远远早于 9 月份公布数据的法定截止日期。【原文：Revolut Ltd. is readying its financial results for 2023 after its auditor signed off on the accounts, putting the fintech well ahead of a September statutory deadline to publish the figures.】

item.title: 中国共同基金要求债券经纪商降低交易费用
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，中国一些最大的共同基金正在要求债券经纪人降低交易费用。【原文：Some of China’s biggest mutual funds are asking bond brokers to lower their trading fees, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Meta 将因 Instagram 和 Facebook 的无广告问题受到欧盟警告
item.description: Meta Platforms 公司将因其在 Instagram 和 Facebook 上提供无广告服务的订阅模式而受到警告，在欧盟根据严厉的新规定对大科技公司发起的最新攻击中，该公司可能面临被重罚的风险。【原文：Meta Platforms Inc. is set to be slapped with a warning over its subscription model for ad-free services on Instagram and Facebook, risking potentially heavy fines in the European Union’s latest attack on Big Tech under tough new rules.】

item.title: 西姆塞克表示仍将征收交易税后土耳其股市跳水
item.description: 土耳其财政部长穆罕默德-西姆塞克（Mehmet Simsek）表示，他正在研究对投资者从股市交易中获利征税的可能性，此后土耳其股市大幅下跌。【原文：Turkish equities fell sharply after Treasury and Finance Minister Mehmet Simsek said he’s studying a possible tax on investors’ profits from stock market trades.】

item.title: 保加利亚鲍里索夫提出组阁以结束危机的申请
item.description: 保加利亚前总理博伊科-鲍里索夫（Boyko Borissov）的政党周一提出了一个政府班子，以结束政治动荡。【原文：Former Bulgarian Prime Minister Boyko Borissov’s party proposed a government lineup on Monday in an effort to end political turmoil.】

item.title: Intesa 计划与至少 45 亿欧元贷款相关的 SRT 交易
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，意大利联合圣保罗银行（Intesa Sanpaolo SpA）正在研究出售与至少 45 亿欧元（48 亿美元）贷款池挂钩的信贷挂钩票据（称为重大风险转移）的交易。【原文：Intesa Sanpaolo SpA is working on deals to sell credit-linked notes known as significant risk transfers tied to a pool of at least €4.5 billion ($4.8 billion) of loans, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: VinFast 创始人的新电动汽车实体或将推动缓慢的汽车销售
item.description: 越南 VinFast 汽车有限公司创始人 Pham Nhat Vuong 创办了一家新公司，以促进这家电动汽车制造商在国内的销售。【原文：Vietnam’s VinFast Auto Ltd. founder Pham Nhat Vuong started a new company to rev up domestic sales of the EV maker’s vehicles, which have been slow to gain traction.】

item.title: 巴基斯坦通胀率六个月来首次上升
item.description: 由于能源成本上升，巴基斯坦 6 月份的通货膨胀率在 6 个月内首次加快。【原文：Pakistan’s inflation quickened in June for the first time in six months as energy costs inched up.】

item.title: 空中客车重返 1 美元商店，这次是与 Spirit 达成资产交易
item.description: 在以几乎为零的价格买下庞巴迪公司陷入困境的C系列飞机项目近七年后，空中客车公司（Airbus SE）将再次进行打折采购；这一次是以象征性的1美元价格购买精神航空系统公司（Spirit AeroSystems Inc.【原文：Almost seven years after picking up Bombardier Inc.’s troubled C-Series aircraft program for next to nothing, Airbus SE is going discount shopping once more — this time for assets being offloaded by Spirit AeroSystems Inc. for a symbolic $1 price tag.】

item.title: 从修理工成长为钢铁巨头的沈文荣去世，享年 78 岁
item.description: 沈文荣，一位从机械修理工成长为中国最大私营企业之一的钢铁巨头，去世了。享年 78 岁。【原文：Shen Wenrong, a steel magnate who went from machine repairman to owner of one of China’s largest private companies, has died. He was 78.】

item.title: 联盟时代开启，南非股票成为热门资产
item.description: 一个对企业友好的南非政府的前景吸引了外国投资者重返该国股市，流入量达到了两年多前的水平。【原文：The prospect of a business-friendly South African government has drawn foreign investors back to the country’s stock market, with inflows reaching levels last seen more than two years ago.】

item.title: 中国人民银行发出可能出售政府债券的信号，为市场反弹降温
item.description: 中国人民银行表示，它将从一级交易商处借入政府债券，这表明它可能在考虑出售证券，为市场反弹降温。【原文：The People’s Bank of China said it will borrow government bonds from primary dealers, a sign it may be contemplating selling securities to cool down a market rally.】

item.title: 受益于阿美石油公司红利，沙特储备跃升至 18 个月新高
item.description: 在国家控制的石油生产商阿美石油公司（Aramco）提高红利支付后，沙特阿拉伯的外汇储备升至 18 个月以来的最高水平。【原文：Saudi Arabia’s foreign reserves rose to the highest in 18 months after state-controlled oil producer Aramco boosted dividend payments.】

item.title: 2019 年以来中国红利股票跑赢同类成长股的幅度最大
item.description: 高股息率的中概股继续受到投资者的青睐，原因是经济前景黯淡，尚未为投资者转向成长股提供多少动力。【原文：Chinese shares with high dividend yields continued to gain popularity among investors as a lackluster economic outlook provided little impetus to shift to growth stocks just yet.】

item.title: 债务缠身的老挝在还款额几乎翻倍的情况下转向延期还款
item.description: 根据一份政府报告，老挝去年的外债支付额几乎翻了一番，达到 9.5 亿美元，这促使这个东南亚国家寻求更多的延期支付，以避免因债务超过经济产出而违约。【原文：Laos’ external debt payments last year nearly doubled to $950 million, prompting the Southeast Asian nation to seek additional deferrals to avoid defaulting on debt that exceeds economic output, according to a government report.】

item.title: 中国游客远离澳门，6 月澳门博彩收入放缓
item.description: 由于没有长假以及中国游客的谨慎情绪影响了全球最大博彩中心的博彩收入，澳门赌场 6 月份的生意放缓。【原文：Macau casinos saw business slow down in June as a lack of long holidays and cautious sentiment among Chinese tourists weighed on gaming revenue in the world’s biggest gambling hub.】

item.title: 日本国内生产总值修正值摇摆不定，令投资者大跌眼镜
item.description: 日本政府统计人员再次修订了日本的经济增长数据，显示年初的经济萎缩程度超过了之前的报告，这一额外的调整使人们对最初数据的可靠性产生了进一步的怀疑。【原文：Japan’s government statisticians again revised the nation’s growth figures to show that the economy shrank at the start of the year more than previously reported, an additional tweak that casts further doubt on the reliability of initial figures.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利团队的特朗普交易取决于经济恶化
item.description: 摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）认为，特朗普赢得总统选举的可能性越来越大，这使得曲线陡峭化成为一个有吸引力的赌注，因为在这种情况下，经济增长可能会放缓，通胀也会加快。【原文：The growing specter of a Trump presidential victory is making curve steepeners an attractive bet as growth will likely slow and inflation quicken under such a scenario, according to Morgan Stanley.】
